perturbation.original_text: Each Party shall present to the other Party every potential Project which such Party desires to pursue.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party shall present to the other Party every potential Venture which such Party desires to pursue.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Project' is defined in Article I. By using 'Venture' interchangeably, it introduces ambiguity as to whether 'Venture' has the same meaning as a 'Project,' thus creating uncertainty in obligations. 'Project' is used throughout the document, and randomly interchanging it with 'Venture' obfuscates the intended meaning.

perturbation.original_text: With respect to any Project, regardless of which Party identified such Project, the Parties agree that Lloyds shall act as prime contractor on any Project and that Lightbridge shall have a right of first refusal to participate in such Project as a sub- contractor to Lloyds, and shall be entitled to perform such work which would generate up to twenty-five percent (25%) of the total fees payable to Lloyds as general contractor under the Project.
perturbation.changed_text: With respect to any Initiative, regardless of which Party identified such Initiative, the Parties agree that Lloyds shall act as prime contractor on any Project and that Lightbridge shall have a right of first refusal to participate in such Project as a sub- contractor to Lloyds, and shall be entitled to perform such work which would generate up to twenty-five percent (25%) of the total fees payable to Lloyds as general contractor under the Project.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Project' is randomly replaced with 'Initiative' at the start of the section, while the rest of the section still refers to 'Project'. This creates a conflict in which undertaking the two companies are collaborating on because 'Initiative' and 'Project' are undefined as similar.

perturbation.original_text: The Recipient agrees that prior to disclosure of Confidential Information to any Affiliate, it will inform the Affiliate of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information and require such Affiliate to treat the Confidential Information as confidential according to this Agreement as if such Affiliate were a Recipient. The Recipient shall, and shall cause each of its Affiliate to, use its best endeavors to procure and ensure at  all times the safe and confidential storage of Confidential Information in their  possession or control. Without limiting the foregoing, the Recipient shall, and shall cause its Affiliate to, safeguard the Confidential Information to the same extent as if it were information of or pertaining to the Recipient. and the Recipient acknowledges that the release, publication or dissemination of the Confidential Information could be harmful to a Project or a Party.
perturbation.changed_text: The Recipient agrees that prior to disclosure of Confidential Data to any Affiliate, it will inform the Affiliate of the confidential nature of the Confidential Data and require such Affiliate to treat the Confidential Information as confidential according to this Agreement as if such Affiliate were a Recipient. The Recipient shall, and shall cause each of its Affiliate to, use its best endeavors to procure and ensure at  all times the safe and confidential storage of Confidential Information in their  possession or control. Without limiting the foregoing, the Recipient shall, and shall cause its Affiliate to, safeguard the Confidential Information to the same extent as if it were information of or pertaining to the Recipient. and the Recipient acknowledges that the release, publication or dissemination of the Confidential Information could be harmful to a Project or a Party.
perturbation.explanation: By alternating between 'Confidential Information' and 'Confidential Data', this section creates ambiguity regarding whether 'Confidential Information' is same with 'Confidential Data'. Because the section begins by talking about 'Confidential Data' without defining it, there is a contradiction in terminology usage.
